cha2.text: The first verse, sung in Japanese, translates to “There is no light in this world; Wrapped in tears; Standing alone.” These lines deepen the sense of isolation and despair introduced in the intro. The world is portrayed as devoid of light, emphasizing the protagonist’s perception of overwhelming darkness.

The imagery of being “wrapped in tears” is particularly poignant. It suggests a complete immersion in sorrow as if the protagonist’s pain has become a tangible entity enveloping them. Yet, despite this overwhelming emotion, they are “standing alone,” indicating a resilience and strength that persists even in the face of profound sadness.

The verse then shifts to English, reiterating and expanding on these themes. “In the shadows, tears illuminate my path” echoes the intro’s concept of tears as a light source. This repetition emphasizes that our pain can guide us, serving as a catalyst for growth and self-discovery. The following Japanese lines reinforce the absence of light in the world and highlight how tears have become a source of illumination, lighting the way forward.
